pull_request.title: feat: automatically select a port by default with `ember serve`
pull_request.body:
Fixes #9512

`ember serve` will now automatically choose a port (starting with 4200), unless a port is explicitly set with the `--port` flag or the `$PORT` env variable.  

## Notes:
The base port has also been changed from 7020 (which seems to have been arbitrarily chosen in 43878e2) to 4200, the current default. The old value of 7020 also doesn't seem to do anything since it's overridden by the default 4200 anyways.

The `should throw error when -p PORT is taken` test block has been moved out of a legacy if statement referencing appveyor.

issue.title: [ENHANCEMENT] feat: add skip-install alias to skip-npm
issue.body:
The `--skip-npm` flag seems rather confusing now that three package managers are supported.

e.g. a valid way to generate an Ember app with pnpm today is:

```sh
ember new example-app --pnpm --skip-npm
```

With this alias it could be written as follows:

```sh
ember new example-app --pnpm --skip-install
```

I don't have a lot of context about the impact of this change, so please let me know if it isn't as simple as just adding an alias 😄

comment.body:
There doesn't appear to be any references [in the guides](https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Aember-learn%2Fguides-source%20skip-npm&type=code).

In the [cli docs](https://cli.emberjs.com/release/advanced-use/cli-commands-reference/) there are three references for which I opened a PR here: https://github.com/ember-learn/cli-guides/pull/308

review.body: lgtm -- do we have any docs/guides pages that need updated as well?

issue.body:
Output from `ember version --verbose && npm --version && yarn --version`:
```
an error
(but outside of my app directory):

os: linux x64

1.22.17
```

With the addon@v2 format on the horizon, I figured I'd give a shot at making my addon true ESM, and not even using CJS / legacy node, by default.

I've run in to a snag, where, due to ember-cli still being in CJS, it cannot import ESM. For example, I have an `addon-main.js`, defined as:
```js
import { dirname } from 'path';
import { fileURLToPath } from 'url';

import { addonV1Shim } from  '@embroider/addon-shim';

const __dirname = dirname(fileURLToPath(import.meta.url));
export default addonV1Shim(__dirname);
```
and in my addon's package.json:
```
  "type": "module",
  "files": [
    "addon-main.js",
    "dist"
  ],
    "ember-addon": {
    "version": 2,
    "type": "addon",
    "main": "addon-main.js",
...
```
and I get the this error when trying to run _any_ `ember` command in the CLI:

```
Error [ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]: Must use import to load ES Module: /✂️/ember-resources/ember-resources/addon-main.js
require() of ES modules is not supported.
require() of /✂️/ember-resources/ember-resources/addon-main.js from /✂️/ember-resources/node_modules/ember-cli/lib/models/package-info-cache/package-info.js is an ES module file as it is a .js file whose nearest parent package.json contains "type": "module" which defines all .js files in that package scope as ES modules.
Instead rename addon-main.js to end in .cjs, change the requiring code to use import(), or remove "type": "module" from /✂️/ember-resources/ember-resources/package.json.
```

comment.body:
You can still use ESM dependencies. 

All v2 addons are esm.
This already works.

 This issue is about not transpiling away esm, which is different.

If your npm package supports browsers, you can use it as of 4 or 5 years ago via emben-auto-import

issue.title: Request: adding ESM Support
issue.body:
Output from `ember version --verbose && npm --version && yarn --version`:
```
an error
(but outside of my app directory):
```

With the addon@v2 format on the horizon, I figured I'd give a shot at making my addon true ESM, and not even using CJS / legacy node, by default.

I've run in to a snag, where, due to ember-cli still being in CJS, it cannot import ESM. For example, I have an `addon-main.js`, defined as:
```js
import { dirname } from 'path';
import { fileURLToPath } from 'url';

export default addonV1Shim(__dirname);
```

and in my addon's package.json:
```
  "type": "module",
  "files": [
    "addon-main.js",
    "dist"

    "ember-addon": {
    "version": 2,
    "type": "addon",
    "main": "addon-main.js",
...
```

and I get the this error when trying to run _any_ `ember` command in the CLI:

What is the recommended way to develop a node module that must also be used in a ember app?

I've run in to a snag, where, due to ember-cli still being in CJS, it cannot import ESM. For example, I have an `addon-main.js`, defined as:
```js
import { dirname } from 'path';
import { fileURLToPath } from 'url';

import { addonV1Shim } from  '@embroider/addon-shim';

const __dirname = dirname(fileURLToPath(import.meta.url));
export default addonV1Shim(__dirname);
```
and in my addon's package.json:
```
  "type": "module",
  "files": [
    "addon-main.js",
    "dist"
  ],
    "ember-addon": {
    "version": 2,
    "type": "addon",
    "main": "addon-main.js",
...
```
and I get the this error when trying to run _any_ `ember` command in the CLI:

```
Error [ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]: Must use import to load ES Module: /✂️/ember-resources/ember-resources/addon-main.js
require() of ES modules is not supported.
require() of /✂️/ember-resources/ember-resources/addon-main.js from /✂️/ember-resources/node_modules/ember-cli/lib/models/package-info-cache/package-info.js is an ES module file as it is a .js file whose nearest parent package.json contains "type": "module" which defines all .js files in that package scope as ES modules.
Instead rename addon-main.js to end in .cjs, change the requiring code to use import(), or remove "type": "module" from /✂️/ember-resources/ember-resources/package.json.
```

issue.title: ember test not working with environmentConfig.rootUrl = null
issue.body:
I have spent about 4 hours today in debugging ember test command and testem module. After executing command `ember test` i always get an error: `not ok 1 Browser "phantomjs [...] [...]" failed to connect. testem.js not loaded?`

Accidentaly i've found that the problem is with my config. I have set rootURL to null in environment.js config file. This is set to null because i'm developing mobile application with emberJS and i need only relative paths to files, so null value is perfect for me. But it breaks ember test command. I've found (after 4h research) that it can be easily fixed by adding:
`ENV.rootURL = '/';`
In the `environment === 'test' section.

---

Output from `ember version --verbose && npm --version`:
```
ember-cli: 2.8.0
http_parser: 2.5.0
node: 4.2.6
v8: 4.5.103.35
uv: 1.8.0
zlib: 1.2.8
ares: 1.10.1-DEV
icu: 55.1
modules: 46
openssl: 1.0.2f
os: linux x64
3.5.2
```

comment.body: Please note that the pattern discussed here is broken for Ember CLI >= 5.0 due to a bug in `ember-cli-inject-live-reload`. I proposed a fix upstream: https://github.com/ember-cli/ember-cli-inject-live-reload/pull/196
